Protocols:

By default your web services should communicate via HTTP over SSL. You should have a pretty good reason for diverging from that.

There are two main options of protocols to use for your API, REST and SOAP.

REST

A protocol that reuses the HTTP verbs and describes resources by URLs. (Simple, right?) For more information, check out wikipedia.

SOAP

An XML based protocol often found in enterprise/banking applications. For more information including a list of advantages/disadvantages, check wikipedia

Most modern APIs are adhering to a RESTful format, rather than using SOAP. With that in mind, REST may be a more cofortable default protocol.

Both REST and SOAP should be well supported by clients.
